data.title: Best Asian in Des Moines!
data.text: Fantastic unique, yet authentic Asian dishes with great rich flavors.  Kung pow chicken, and crispy creamy Crab Rangoon reign supreme in my book.  Outstanding in comparison to other Asian restaurants in Des Moines for sure.  If seeking great flavors in Asian fusion cuisine when in Des Moines, Cafe Su is and has been the place to eat for over 20 years!

data.title: Real Asian
data.text: Interesting mix of music, local art and actual freshly made Asian food.  Priced right, good service.  Definitely not your typical Asian restaurant.

data.title: Disaster
data.text: We got togo from this restaurant. The lady told it kitchen was closed but as we told we r not gonna eat here she said ok n we ordered food. She also gave us free dessert as Dessert was free with groupon coupon. After we came home and opened boxes to eat...it was a DISASTER. We dint like any thing we ordered. The dish has no salt n no taste at all. Even the vegetables dint taste good. And about The dessert we got chocolate cake. There was no cake but only cream. It made me feel like that was some leftover piece of cake from someones plate. I m never ever going again. So disapponiting.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: This place has amazing food.  Ask for their tea, it is delicious.  I recommend the angry chicken and lemon chicken.  It is a little different than traditional chinese food, it is definitely not like pf changs (which I like too).

data.title: Rude and Disresptful Staff lost a potentially good customer for life.
data.text: I went to this establishment for the first time last night to try their food and stay late for karaoke. There was a couple that entered in front of us who were greeted warmly and seated. We were ignored for about 5 minutes when someone finally just said "need a table" and seated us in a far off corner. We them proceeded to be ignored for 15 minutes. No one brought us water or took our drink order. We decided to leave since we hadn't been acknowledged the entire time we were there. I tried to call and speak to a manager and no one would answer the phone. The prices were way too expensive and the restaurant was way too empty for us to be treated that way.

data.title: Went for lunch, will go back for dinner
data.text: Comfortably decorated place in old Valley Junction.  Food was very tasty and the portions were generous.  Prices were fair for the servings.  Service was good.

data.title: Rebirth of cafe su
data.text: My friends and I spent a wonderful Sunday night at Cafe Su. Su is so gracious and made our night special. The food was awesome. Everything was served hot and done perfectly. Su started up the karaoke and DJ it herself. A night of singing, food and drinks made a quiet Sunday night into something to start your new week off with a smile.  It is great to see a privately owned business keeping it fresh! Thank you Su for years of perfection.

data.title: Oh Well....
data.text: Nice try, we did miss the place. Terrible decor, menu uninspired. With all of the places to dine out, they needed to at the very least keep what they had years ago. Seemed as though if the owner or wait staff didn't know you, your table was ignored.

data.title: SLOW
data.text: 15 minutes for water, 30 minutes for edamame, 1hr and 15 minutes for food for two.  No acknowledgment or apology for delays.  Food above average.  Understaffed in kitchen & front of house.

data.title: Fantastic Dinner
data.text:
I just had a wonderful meal at Cafe Su.  Try the Orange Chicken or Mongolian Beef.
I can't wait to go back.  Loved the Jazz.  Great service too.

data.title: Slow service, mediocre food, great salsa dance lessons!
data.text: We arrived at 7, ordered by 7:20 and received our food at 8:15. This wasn't really ideal because our plan was to go to the free salsa/bachata lessons by Salsa Des Moines that began at 8 PM. The food was overly salty and without much other flavors. They have a wide beer/ wine selection, and our potstickers arrived quickly. The free dance lessons were a bonus!

data.title: Ok
data.text: Cafe Su has a lot of potential. I'll start there. The day I decided to go was a cold(below zero wind chill) day and I got there before the 11 am open time.  I waited and at 11 it wasn't open, called to get answering machine and waited till 1130 and ended up going next door to Coopers. There were at least three parties at Coopers that were there only because Cafe Su wasn't open. Coopers gets a lot of business from Cafe Su because it doesn't open anywhere near its advertised time(also announced on answering machine). So when I left Coopers, I decided to check to see if, after 12noon, it had opened yet. It was open but no customers yet(all were at Coopers). So I ordered takeout for a later dinner.  Apparently the previous nights staff had not bothered to clean up and the only waiter was trying to manage the complete cleanup and deal with the work ahead of him. Very nice waiter, recently back from service to our country. The order took 30 minutes to prepare two meals. I was the only customer at the time.  The hot and sour soup was good, a tad different than I'm used to, with a bit of sweet and cilantro in it, which I liked a lot.  The basil chicken was also very good. I asked the waiter to have the angry chicken made very mild. When I opened the container, it looked like a half cup of dried pepper had been added to it. Very very very spicy. And I saw the waiter write my request. Apparently the cook didn't quite understand. The atmosphere is very artsy. The good news is that Cafe Su has a chance to improve.  And I do understand the situation.  I also am very tolerant which most are not. Maybe I'll check them out again in about 6 months and see how they are doing.

data.title: Very Poor
data.text:
I really don't write reviews b/c I have spent 20 years in restaurants and everyone has a bad day BUT......
*the food was very bland, tasteless, crab rangoon was all shell w/ very little filling.  My finacee's red curry tasted like beef stroganoff, his sister's coconut chicken tasted nothing like coconut, and the veggies were over cooked in all the dishes.  We were suspicious we got the wrong dishes but honestly they were so tasteless it was impossible to know with the exception of the Angry Chicken which has a delicious sauce.
*the service was SLOW.  It took probably 20 mins to get our 1st round of drinks.  We had appetizers before they came.  There was about 4 tables seated in the whole place.
*our server knew nothing about the menu.  He did say several times that he had only been there 6 days but they should really step up their training.  He told us they had no sushi and we later discovered that there were 3 rolls as the nights special.  
*we used a Groupon which they tried in a couple different ways not to honor as it read.  Then when we finally talked to the owner, who was very nice, to straighten it out, we still didn't get credited for what we had been overcharged.

This was the worst dining experience I have had in quite some time and I can only hope the owner reads these reviews and steps up the game at this place.

data.title: Tops for Chinese food
data.text: Have tried countless chinese restaurants throughout Iowa, and Cafe Su is some of the best for their delicious cuisine. The newly renovated restaurant is inviting. Have never been there for the music or their bar, I just go for the great food. Mongolian beef was wonderful. Meat was tender and flavorful. Have been going for about 20 years and flavor is the reason why.

data.title: Great restaurant in historic valley junction
data.text:
Su has done an amazing job with her restaurant. The menu is extensive. There are so many choices that it makes your decision a tough one. We started with the chicken egg rolls and chose an entree that was not listed on the menu. It was a version of szechuan chicken, with our choice of veg and beef added.  Everything was wonderful and the portions are generous. She plays a great selection of music. Frank Sinatra and other artists from that period fill the air. It makes you want to get up and dance, right in the middle of dinner.
And, speaking of dancing. You can join in on the fun on Tuesdays at 8, for dance lessons, followed by open dancing. I live close to the junction so it's great to find yet another great place to dine and do something fun.

data.title: Quiet chinese restaurant in Valley Junction.
data.text: Enjoyed a quiet evening at Café Su.  Their cashew chicken was very good, although it could have used a few more cashews for my taste.  Their fried rice was unusual - it did not have the egg you normally see and was a very dark color from the sauce (soy I think).  It tasted fine, but not what you normally expect.  The wait staff was prompt, but not overly friendly - they seemed very rushed.  I think there was only one waitress on while we were there and while there were not many customers there (we were dining early) she was kept busy.  Prices were good and the food was enjoyable.
